introduction: Iâ€™m a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of British Columbia, working with Prof. Evan Shelhamer and Prof. Leonid Sigal. Previously, I was fortunate to work with Prof. Yu-Chiang Frank Wang at National Taiwan University and Prof. Ming-Hsuan Yang at UC Merced.
My Primary research interests lie in Computer Vision, with a particular focus on multi-modal models' adaptability, continual learning, and efficient computation.
Prior to my acadmeic career, I was a Machine Learning Engineer at Dcard, where I designed a recommendation system using machine learning algorithms for over 15 million users.
I completed my bachelor's and master's degrees in Computer Science from National Taiwan University, where I conducted research in the Computational Learning Lab under Prof. Hsuan-Tien Lin.
